bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Order

person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THE UNITED CIRCUIT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, and Sister M. Angelique, Sisiter Superior of the House of Good Shepherd, for a Writ of Certiorari.} No.1078
James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, and Sister M. Angelique, Appellants, -vs- Yvonne LeFevre, Georgette Normand and Marie LeFevre, Respondednts.} No.1078

It appearing to the Court that respondent, Georgette Normand, did on or about June 7th, 1904, appear and surrender herself to James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, and has been by said Lavin, acting under instructions of the United States Tresury Department, deported to France, and that the order of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals herein has been fully complied with in so far as said defendant, Georgette Normand is concerned, it is now, on mortion of Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney, odered that the sum of five hundred dollars, bail deposited by H.C. Gill for said Georgette Normand, be paid by the Clerk of this Court to the said H.C. Gill, to be by his paid to M. Joujon Roche, United States French Consular Agent.
Done in open Court this 30th day of June, 1904
